body:
The Unofficial Stremio Addon SDK for Crystal

Website â€¢ Shard Docs

An opinionated database driven framework to rapidly develop Stremio Addons, written in Crystal Lang. ## Installation 1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: stremio-addon-devkit: github: ryan-kraay/stremio-addon-devkit ``` 2. Run `shards install` ## Usage ```crystal require "stremio-addon-devkit" ``` TODO: Write usage instructions here ## Development TODO: Write development instructions here ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`) 5. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [Ryan Kraay](https://github.com/ryan-kraay) - creator and maintainer

instance_methods.name: id
instance_methods.doc: `id`: **required** - string, the id of the catalog, can be any unique string describing the catalog (unique per addon, as an addon can have many catalogs), for example: if the catalog name is "Favourite Youtube Videos", the id can be "fav_youtube_videos"
instance_methods.summary: #id: required - string, the id of the catalog, can be any unique string describing the catalog (unique per addon, as an addon can have many catalogs), for example: if the catalog name is "Favourite Youtube Videos", the id can be "fav_youtube_videos"

Enables Filtering Based on Genre *or other tags*

constructors.args_string: (genres : GenresResultType, isRequired : Bool = false, max_selectable : UInt32 = 1)
constructors.args_html: (genres : GenresResultType, isRequired : Bool = false, max_selectable : UInt32 = 1)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(isRequired, max_selectable, &block) do
  yield
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: options
def.body:
g = genres.call
if @optionsLimit > 0_u32
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("ExtraGenre#max_selectable cannot be 0"))
end
if @optionsLimit > g.size
  raise(ArgumentError.new("ExtraGenre@max_selectable cannot be larger than the number of genres(#{g.size})"))
end
g.to_json(json)

instance_methods.name: options
instance_methods.doc:
`options`: optional - an explicit lists of "steps" to follow.  If an empty list is defined, the default value of "100" will be used.
This means the addon will request 100 entries, until it receives less than 100 entries (to signify the end of the list)
instance_methods.summary: #options: optional - an explicit lists of "steps" to follow.

types.name: Manifest
types.doc:
A Manifest consists of a collection of ResourceTypes
 Source: https://github.com/Stremio/stremio-addon-sdk/blob/master/docs/api/responses/manifest.md
types.summary: A Manifest consists of a collection of ResourceTypes Source: https://github.com/Stremio/stremio-addon-sdk/blob/master/docs/api/responses/manifest.md

class_methods.name: build
class_methods.doc:
A static function call to inline the complete construction
of a manifest object.

Example:
```
manifest = Manifest(ContentType).build(
  id: "com.stremio.addon.example",
  name: "DemoAddon",
  description: "An example stremio addon",
  version: "0.0.1") do |conf|
  conf << CatalogMovie.new(ContentType::Movie, "movie4u", "Movies for you")
end
```

TODO:  Should this be moved into the macro?  As a method on .new()?
class_methods.summary: A static function call to inline the complete construction of a manifest object.

def.name: build
def.body:
manifest = Manifest.new(*args, **named_args)
yield manifest
return manifest

def.name: resources
def.body:
result = [] of ManifestResource
resource = ManifestResource.new(ResourceType::Catalog)
each_catalog do |catalog|
  resource.types << catalog.type
end
if resource.types.empty?
else
  result << resource
end
result

def.name: types
def.body:
type_set = Set(ContentType).new
resources.each do |resource|
  type_set.concat(resource.types)
end
type_set

instance_methods.doc: `version`: **required** - string, [semantic version](https://semver.org/) of the addon
instance_methods.summary: #version: required - string, semantic version of the addon

def.name: bind
def.body:
callbacks = MultiBlockHandler.new
yield callbacks
if (!callbacks.catalog_movie?) && (!manifest.catalog_movies.empty?)
  raise(ManifestBindingError.new("Movie CatalogMovies defined, but catalog_movie callback was not provided"))
else
  if !manifest.catalog_movies.empty?
    route_catalogs(manifest, &callbacks.catalog_movie)
  end
end
if !callbacks.manifest?
  callbacks.manifest do |env, addon|
    addon.manifest
  end
end
route_manifest(manifest, &callbacks.manifest)

instance_methods.name: route_catalogs
instance_methods.doc:
Assigns all manifest.catalogs objects with `&handler`.
If `&handler` returns a CatalogMovieResponse, this response will be serialized
in such a way that Stremio Clients can understand it (ie: proper headers will be set)
If `&handler` returns `nil`, this means that the callback will provide
the response
instance_methods.summary: Assigns all manifest.catalogs objects with &handler.

def.name: route_catalogs
def.body:
resource = ResourceType::Catalog
manifest.catalog_movies.each do |catalog|
  self.get("/#{resource}/#{catalog.type}/#{catalog.id}.json") do |env|
    addon = (CatalogMovieRequest.new(manifest, catalog)).parse(env)
    response = handler.call(env, addon)
    if response.is_a?(CatalogMovieResponse)
      response = response.as(CatalogMovieResponse)
      env.response.print(response.to_json)
      addon.set_response_headers(env)
    end
    nil
  end
end

def.name: route_manifest
def.body:
self.get("/manifest.json") do |env|
  addon = (ManifestRequest.new(manifest)).parse(env)
  response = handler.call(env, addon)
  if response.is_a?(ManifestResponse)
    response = response.as(ManifestResponse)
    env.response.print(response.to_json)
    addon.set_response_headers(env)
  end
  nil
end

types.name: ManifestResource
types.doc:
Represents a single entry in the "resources: []" described in the manifest.json

There is a more condensed form of this (ie: `resources: ["catalog"]`).  However, we also use this more
verbose form to generate the `types: []` entry in the manifest.json.

source: https://github.com/Stremio/stremio-addon-sdk/blob/master/docs/api/responses/manifest.md#advanced
types.summary: Represents a single entry in the "resources: []" described in the manifest.json

instance_methods.name: id
instance_methods.doc:
You can use any unique string for the `id`.
In this case we use the corresponding IMDB ID.
Stremio features an system add-on called Cinemeta.
This add-on provides detailed metadata for any movie or
TV show that matches a valid IMDB ID.

NOTE: All IMDB ID's begin with 'tt' (ie: tt0032138)
instance_methods.summary: You can use any unique string for the #id.

NOTE: All IMDB ID's begin with 'tt' (ie: tt0032138)
instance_methods.summary: You can use any unique string for the #id.

macros.name: link_legacy
macros.doc: ``director``, ``cast`` - _optional_  - directors and cast, both arrays of names (string) (warning: this will soon be deprecated in favor of ``links``)
macros.summary: #director, #cast - optional - directors and cast, both arrays of names (string) (warning: this will soon be deprecated in favor of #links)

def.name: link_legacy
def.body:
category = 
{{ category }}
.to_s
      array_open : Bool = false

      begin
        @links.select do |link|
          
# String comparisons are certainly slower than comparing enumeration

          
# types, but the flexibility we gain by using strings will (hopefully)

          
# make-up for it

          link.category == category
        
end.each do |link|
          if array_open == false
            
# We want to only show our field/array *if* there is a matching value

            json.string 
{{ key.id.stringify }}

            json.start_array
            array_open = true
          
end
          link.name.to_json json
        
end
      
ensure
        if array_open
          json.end_array
        
end
      
end

types.name: RouteHandler
types.doc:
Inspired by Kemal::RouteHandler, this Handler is not
a singleton nor will it return a http-404 if a match is not made

It provides a Kemal::RouteHandler-like interface, but respects Kemals
request that libraries use `add_handler` to inject routes, rather
than adding them to the global Kemal::RouteHandler.
types.summary: Inspired by Kemal::RouteHandler, this Handler is not a singleton nor will it return a http-404 if a match is not made

class_methods.name: redirect
class_methods.args_string: (env : HTTP::Server::Context, url : String, status_code : Int32 = 302, *, body : String | Nil = nil, close : Bool = true)
class_methods.args_html: (env : HTTP::Server::Context, url : String, status_code : Int32 = 302, *, body : String | Nil = nil, close : Bool = true)

def.name: redirect
def.body:
response = env.response
response.headers.add("Location", url.to_s)
response.status_code = status_code
if body
  response.print(body)
end
if close
  response.close
end

instance_methods.name: add_route
instance_methods.doc:
Adds a given route to routing tree.
Should not be needed to call directly, use the macros below
instance_methods.summary: Adds a given route to routing tree.

def.name: call
def.body:
route = lookup_route(context.request.method, context.request.path)
if route.found?
else
  return call_next(context)
end
route.params.each do |key, value|
  context.params.url[key] = unescape_url_param(value)
end
route.payload.handler.call(context)

instance_methods.name: lookup_route
instance_methods.doc: Looks up the route from the Radix::Tree for the first time and caches to improve performance.
instance_methods.summary: Looks up the route from the Radix::Tree for the first time and caches to improve performance.

def.name: lookup_route
def.body:
lookup_path = radix_path(verb, path)
if cached_route = @cached_routes[lookup_path]?
  return cached_route
end
route = @routes.find(lookup_path)
if (verb == "HEAD") && (!route.found?)
  route = @routes.find(radix_path("GET", path))
end
if route.found?
  if @cached_routes.size == CACHED_ROUTES_LIMIT
    @cached_routes.clear
  end
  @cached_routes[lookup_path] = route
end
route

types.name: StremioRouteHandler
types.doc:
Some older stremio clients (ie: Android TV) incorrectly encode
paths, so they're incompatible with https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.3
Specifically, "_,.,- and ~" are encoded by these clients (rfc3986 says they should NOT).
This class will encode strings in a way that's compatible with these
non-conforming clients
types.summary: Some older stremio clients (ie: Android TV) incorrectly encode paths, so they're incompatible with https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986#section-2.3 Specifically, "_,.,- and ~" are encoded by these clients (rfc3986 says they should NOT).

class_methods.name: encode
class_methods.doc:
Encodes a string such that older stremio clients can access the urls
ie: "foo-bar" === "foo%2Dbar"
class_methods.summary: Encodes a string such that older stremio clients can access the urls ie: "foo-bar" === "foo%2Dbar"

def.name: encode
def.body:
String.build do |io|
  URI.encode(path, io, space_to_plus: false) do |byte|
    char = byte.unsafe_chr
    char.ascii_alphanumeric? || (char.in?('/', ':', '.', '*'))
  end
end

instance_methods.name: add_route
instance_methods.doc:
Anytime routes are added, we'll also add an optional redirect
if any parameters need to be escaped for non-compliant stremio clients
instance_methods.summary: Anytime routes are added, we'll also add an optional redirect if any parameters need to be escaped for non-compliant stremio clients

def.name: add_route
def.body:
super(method, path, &handler)
begin
  encoded_path = self.class.encode(path)
  super(method, encoded_path) do |env|
    unencoded = path.split('/')
    encoded = encoded_path.split('/')
    current = env.request.path.split('/')
    result = Array(String).new
    pos = 0
    unencoded.each do
      if unencoded[pos] == encoded[pos]
        if encoded[pos].includes?('*')
          result = result + current[pos..(current.size - 1)]
          break
        else
          result << current[pos]
        end
      else
        result << unencoded[pos]
      end
      pos = pos + 1
    end
    final_path = result.join("/")
    if env.request.query.is_a?(String)
      final_path = final_path + ("?" + (env.request.query.as(String)))
    end
    self.class.redirect(env, final_path, status_code: 301)
  end
rescue Radix::Tree::DuplicateError
end

types.name: KeyRing
types.doc:
A KeyRing represents a public/private key mapping.
WARNING: The position/index of a specific `String` within the keyring IS important.
The purpose of the `KeyRing` is to keep `KeyRingSecret` secret.  This is accomplished
by sharing the index number with the outside world, but the actual secret is kept internally.

An example would be:
```
keyring = {"hotdog": "secret_phrase", "potato": "the secret word"}
```
Let's assume we have the phrase "Top Secret" that we want to encrypt and the result is "ADGAD1234==".
We give this encrypted content to a random user.  This random user doesn't actually know what the
phrase is - but when they return it, we want to decrypt "ADGAD1234==" and get our original phrase
"Top Secret".  However, we don't know if "secret_phrase" or "the secret word" was used to decrypt
"ADGAD1234==".  We could try them all, but that would take time.

A niative solution would be to prepent the actual secret used with the encrypted content.  So
we'd send our random user the phrase "the secret word:ADGAD1234==", but this means the user
could easily decrypt the content, modify it, and send it to our application.  INSTEAD we'll use
the "public" phrase and give our random user "potato:ADGAD1234==".  The word "potato" is completely
meaningless to our random user (as is the encrypted content), but when the user gives our application
the phrase "potato:ADGAD1234==" - the word "potato" has a meaning for US and we know that we'll need
to use "the secret word" to decrypt "ADGAD1234==", which will reveal our secret "Top Secret".

`KeyRing` behaves in the same way, except instead of long words like "hotdog" and "potato", we use
index number.  Basically
```
keyring = [nil, "secret_phrase", nil, nil, "the secret word", nil]
```
and we send our random user "4:ADGAD1234==".  Notice that "the secret word" is at the index 4 in our Array.
This is also why it's critical that we never change the order of this index, but you're welcome to replace
the nil with new secrets.
types.summary: A KeyRing represents a public/private key mapping.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Constructs a fixed length `Array`, raises an exception if unable to parse `csv`
* `csv` : A comma seperated tuple of "position:secret".

Example
```
x = KeyRing.new("5:world,3:hello")
puts x # [ nil, nil, nil, "hello", nil, "world", nil ]
```
constructors.summary: Constructs a fixed length Array, raises an exception if unable to parse csv * csv : A comma seperated tuple of "position:secret".

types.name: Opt
types.doc: This is an internal flag, which means we do NOT want to use the `KeyRing`
types.summary: This is an internal flag, which means we do NOT want to use the KeyRing

types.name: Session
types.doc: A `Session` defines a way to encode/decode user content in a secure and url safe manner
types.summary: A Session defines a way to encode/decode user content in a secure and url safe manner

def.name: decode_to_bytes
def.body:
edata = Base64.decode(data)
header = Header.new(edata.to_slice)
case header.version
when V1::Header::VERSION
  v1 = V1.new(@ring, @iv_static)
  v1.decode(edata)
else
  raise(HeaderMalformed.new("Unsupported Version #{header.version}"))
end

instance_methods.name: encode
instance_methods.args_string: (data, compress : Bool = true, random_generator = Random::Secure) : String
instance_methods.args_html: (data, compress : Bool = true, random_generator = Random::Secure) : String

def.name: encode
def.body:
latest = V1.new(@ring, @iv_static)
Base64.urlsafe_encode(latest.encode(data.to_slice, compress, random_generator), padding: false)

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Constructs UserData Version 1 Interface

Parameters:
 - `@ring` can either be a `KeyRing` or `KeyRing::Opt::Disable`
 - `@iv_static` a static portion of the initial vector used to encrypt the user data

WARNING: Using `KeyRing::Opt::Disable` means that encryption will *not* be used

instance_methods.name: encode
instance_methods.args_string: (data, compress : Bool = true, random_generator = Random::Secure) : Bytes
instance_methods.args_html: (data, compress : Bool = true, random_generator = Random::Secure) : Bytes

def.name: encode
def.body:
header = Header.create(random_generator)
header.compress = compress == true ? 1_u8 : 0_u8
if @ring.is_a?(KeyRing)
  used_positions = (@ring.as(KeyRing)).map_with_index do |secret, pos|
    {pos, secret}
  end.select do |pair|
    !pair[1].nil?
  end.map do |pair|
    pair[0]
  end
  if used_positions.empty?
    raise(IndexError.new("Empty KeyRing: use KeyRing::Opt::Disable, if intended"))
  end
  index = random_generator.rand(0..(used_positions.size - 1))
  header.keyring = used_positions[index].to_u8
else
  if @ring.is_a?(KeyRing::Opt) && ((@ring.as(KeyRing::Opt)) == KeyRing::Opt::Disable)
    header.keyring = KeyRing::Opt::Disable.value.to_u8
  else
    raise(Exception.new("Unreachable"))
  end
end
encrypt(header, compress(header, data.to_slice))

class_methods.name: create
class_methods.doc:
Returns a `Header` constructed with `bytes`
Paramaters:
 * `bytes`: The header in network byte order, meaning bytes[0] contains the "high" bits

WARNING: the use of `Header.new()` should be avoided (and for some reason we cannot create our own initialize()
class_methods.summary: Returns a Header constructed with bytes Paramaters: * bytes: The header in network byte order, meaning bytes[0] contains the "high" bits

class_methods.name: create
class_methods.doc:
Returns an empty `Header` header with the version set

Parameters:
 * `random_generator` uses a pseudo or real random number generator, `::Random#new` can be used for unit tests
WARNING: the use of `Header.new()` should be avoided (and for some reason we cannot create our own initialize()
class_methods.summary: Returns an empty Header header with the version set

def.name: create
def.body:
rtn = Header.new(Bytes[0, 0])
rtn.version = Header::VERSION
rtn.iv_random = {% if true %}
                          b = Bytes[0]
                          random_generator.random_bytes(b)
                          b[0]
                        {% end %}
rtn

def.name: to_s
def.body:
__temp_85 = Array(String).new
__temp_85 << "reserve -- Binary:#{sprintf("%01b", reserve)} Hex:#{sprintf("%X", reserve)} Decimal:#{reserve}"
__temp_85 << "keyring -- Binary:#{sprintf("%03b", keyring)} Hex:#{sprintf("%X", keyring)} Decimal:#{keyring}"
__temp_85 << "compress -- Binary:#{sprintf("%01b", compress)} Hex:#{sprintf("%X", compress)} Decimal:#{compress}"
__temp_85 << "version -- Binary:#{sprintf("%03b", version)} Hex:#{sprintf("%X", version)} Decimal:#{version}"
__temp_85 << "iv_random -- Binary:#{sprintf("%08b", iv_random)} Hex:#{sprintf("%X", iv_random)} Decimal:#{iv_random}"
__temp_85.join("\n")

instance_methods.name: to_slice
instance_methods.doc:
Our enrypted userdata contains a custom header.  We can support different versions of these header.
This class defines Version 1.
WARNING: Headers are stored and transmitted as big endian (aka: network byte order)
instance_methods.summary: Our enrypted userdata contains a custom header.

def.name: to_slice
def.body:
__temp_78 = Bytes.new(BYTE_COUNT)
__temp_83 = 0
__temp_82 : UInt64 = 0
__temp_84 = 0
__temp_82 = __temp_82 ^ (reserve.to_u64 << __temp_84)
__temp_84 = __temp_84 + 1
while __temp_84 > 8
  __temp_78[__temp_83] = __temp_82.to_u8!
  __temp_82 = __temp_82 >> 8
  __temp_83 = __temp_83 + 1
  __temp_84 = __temp_84 - 8
end
__temp_82 = __temp_82 ^ (keyring.to_u64 << __temp_84)
__temp_84 = __temp_84 + 3
while __temp_84 > 8
  __temp_78[__temp_83] = __temp_82.to_u8!
  __temp_82 = __temp_82 >> 8
  __temp_83 = __temp_83 + 1
  __temp_84 = __temp_84 - 8
end
__temp_82 = __temp_82 ^ (compress.to_u64 << __temp_84)
__temp_84 = __temp_84 + 1
while __temp_84 > 8
  __temp_78[__temp_83] = __temp_82.to_u8!
  __temp_82 = __temp_82 >> 8
  __temp_83 = __temp_83 + 1
  __temp_84 = __temp_84 - 8
end
__temp_82 = __temp_82 ^ (version.to_u64 << __temp_84)
__temp_84 = __temp_84 + 3
while __temp_84 > 8
  __temp_78[__temp_83] = __temp_82.to_u8!
  __temp_82 = __temp_82 >> 8
  __temp_83 = __temp_83 + 1
  __temp_84 = __temp_84 - 8
end
__temp_82 = __temp_82 ^ (iv_random.to_u64 << __temp_84)
__temp_84 = __temp_84 + 8
while __temp_84 > 8
  __temp_78[__temp_83] = __temp_82.to_u8!
  __temp_82 = __temp_82 >> 8
  __temp_83 = __temp_83 + 1
  __temp_84 = __temp_84 - 8
end
__temp_78[__temp_83] = __temp_82.to_u8
__temp_78
